title: Prima vota a New York City - soggiorno Pod Times Square
text: È stata la nostra prima visita a New York e, in generale, negli Stati Uniti. Possiamo solo consigliare questo hotel a chi, come noi, vuole visitare la città e vedere il più possibile. Le stanze sono davvero piccole, ma per dormirci la notte bastano ed avanzano. Sono molto pulite e non abbiamo avuto alcun tipo di problema. Il letto Queen-Size è un po’ piccolo per due persone adulte, ma come già detto, per soli scopi notturni, basta ed avanza. Il quartiere offre molto, sia in termini di cibo che di negozi per le prime esigenze, ecc. È davvero situato perfettamente, a 5 minuti di camminata dall’inizio di Times Square e a qualche minuto dalla stazione degli autobus e dalla prima stazione della metropolitana. Se dovessimo tornare in città, sicuramente sceglieremmo di nuovo il Pod Times Square. Una cosa però che ci mancava era al meno un piccolo armadietto o qualcosa di simile per mettere i vestiti. C'era solo un'attacca panni dove si potevano appoggiare i vestit all'entrata ma sinceramente non era l'ideale.

title: The best value and comfort in Time Square area.
text: Ok, I have stayed at many places in and around Time Square, and this is my new favorite place. Hear me out, This may be the smallest room I have ever stayed in in the area, but it had everything I needed, was comfortable and there was a beautiful simplicity to the room, bathroom,and desk area. My son and I stayed here for 7 nights during a spring break trip to the city. For a boys trip the bunk bed layout was perfect. Location is also a big plus. You are two blocks from Time Square, Subway, and great restaurants. Over the years I have come to find that every place I stayed at in Time Square is overpriced, rundown, and not very hospitable. The Pod Time square has changed this for me, they are affordable, have a great staff (let us check in early), and  the rooms are clean, bedding in comfortable, and was the right balance of everything we needed and nothing we did not. Will stay there again if given the chance!

title: Poor service poor hygiene
text: Juan Carlos the receptionist was very nice all the rest of reception staff were not very friendly. My room was cleaned ONCE in 7 days. They charged a tax at the beginning of the trip which is basically a deposit which is refunded after your stay. BUT there is a chargeable facility tax which comes out of your account which they do not tell you about. There no GYM in the hotel or pool so I’m not sure what facilities they are charging you for. Also the fact they cleaned the room once in 7 days why am I paying a facility tax??

title: Great Stay in Times Square
text: Friendly, helpful staff.  Felt safe and secure. Very quick resolution to request for room maintenance.  I have stayed at the Pod before, always satisfied.  The common areas are great, plenty of room to spread out, work remotely, visit with friends/family.

title: Clean, Comfortable and noiseless prison cell!
text:
We found a very tiny room but clean, comfortable bed and with no noise at all at night.
The location is perfect, really near by Times Square / Metro station. 
They didn't clean the room after first night

title: Regular
text: The location of the hotel is good, the rooms are very small. When faced with a problem, they do not respond adequately and for cleaning they have to be scheduled and they do not always respect the agreed date. If you forget something in the room, consider it lost. It doesn't have breakfast.

title: Great value for the money
text: The staff and accommodations were excellent!  Clean, close to attractions, comfy pillows and bed.  Street traffic was at a minimum.  Love the free tour of Central Park. Guide was friendly and accommodating  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent
text: This is a very nice hotel, at a great location with affordable prices, beautiful breakfast to start your day off before you hit the city. It’s 5 minutes away from train stops to anywhere in NY. The staff is very friendly. Thank you Pod Times Square!

title: Good quality-price ratio
text: The design is perfect. Very small but the space is super well used. The location is perfect. The only criticism is how bad the mattresses are. You wake up with terrible back pain. They should be checked and changed. I don't know if it was just our room, or happens in all

title: Pod Times Square
text: The Pod is perfect location for travelling around NY. We booked a bunk room as I was travelling with a child (10 years old). The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that the room was a bit small for 2 people with luggage

title: Excellent hotel Great location
text: Didn't think that a hotel at this location would be this great. Neat, little rooms, cozy beds with multiple blankets. A little bit of street noise, that can easily be cancelled by earplugs. Nice, hot shower, room was cleaned multiple times throughout our stay. A TV for each of the beds. Helpful, nice staff. The location is just perfect, right in the middle of Manhattan. Would definitely stay again.

title: The POD just might become my new Hotel PAD!
text:
Prior to checking into The POD, I had spent a few nights at a luxury hotel, The Westin/Times Square.
I was Very Curious about the PODS hotel design, the hotel's concept and amenities…especially in a city like New York which offers so many hotel options.
There is a difference in the design of the facilities, however, when it comes to the Customer Service, Staff Friendliness and attention to detail... THE POD will be my first choice during my next visit to Manhattan.
Initially, I only booked two days for my stay, but after the first night, I decided to extend my experience for an additional three more days.
Thanks POD for such a Wonderful Experience.

title: Good
text: I was sent in New york by my employer on a project assignment for a fundraising event in brooklyn art cave. I found brooklyn art cave and organised the event. The event is today but I'm not going. I don't feel well.

title: Great location and good staff
text: Room (bunkbeds) was small but more than enough to unpack your suitcase and a decent bathroom. Bunkbed was a bit squeaky which was a little bit of a shame, but overall price/quality/location was at a good ratio! Sometimes hard to fall asleep again after waking up due to the lack of curtains (light stilll comes through the shutters) and the occasional NY honking cars and sirens, but would still definitely recommend when going with friends.

title: Fabulous stay
text:
Fantastic location, very good value. 
Easy to walk to most iconic places. 
Staff very friendly. Nice to have a bar to relax in. Also there is an outside terrace which would be lovely in the warmer months.

title: Everything you need to be near the heart of NYC
text: Just off Times Square, close to everything including transportation around the boroughs. Easy to go out and pop in to refresh and go back out again. Staff is friendly and knowledgable. Ease and convenience to NYC!

title: Vision Expo East at Javits Center
text: Overall stay was very good. Staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions for dining and holding bags for afternoon pickup after morning checkout. The complaint for this visit is the shower curtain (for a single bed room) was about six inches off the floor, causing a flood in the bathroom for every shower. Also, There was no provision for placing toiletries and such (tooth brushes, toothpaste, razor, etc.) in the bathroom. This was in contrast to the bunk room I had stayed in last year. The bunk room had a huge bathroom with a glass enclosed shower and space to place and keep toiletries during my stay.  The shower curtain and lack of shelf space in the bathroom are aggravating factors that should not exist, even in a "Pod". It's a pain to have to pack and unpack toiletries every time you use the bathroom!

title: Simple and affordable
text:
If you're looking for fancy or roomy, this isn't the place for you. But it was clean, simple and worked for our needs. The bunk room felt a bit like a college dorm room. If you have a long stay, and a lot of luggage, this won't work as there isn't a ton of storage. But it worked for us for a couple nights. The room makes good use of the space with lots of outlets for chargers, lots of hooks, and sleek design. It was perfect for a short stay and a great price for something so close to everything! 15 minute walk to the shows on Broadway (about $20 by uber) and a 4 minute walk to the Port Authority (bus station).
It was also suprisingly quiet at night, which I appreciated!

title: Good Hotel for stay in Time Square
text: Good Hotel for sleep and explore the city all day! Great Location, near dinners, markets, starbucks, Subway or take a Bus. Rooms are very small inside but funcionally. Lobby is simple. In general matter, good hotel to go to sleep no more amenities inside. I leave the hotel early in the morning, and arrive late in the night and stay only for sleep, take a shower and change wardrobe.

title: Very cozy place
text:
Small rooms but well designed, this was a very cozy place, conveniently located and with nice staff. 
For once, the pillows were perfect and the mattresses firm. We slept very well! 
A very good experience.

title: Hidden Costs
text: Most of the staff was super friendly and helpful, except for one very snarky staff member working behind the desk. Also: You pay for your stay, but once you arrive you’ll get charged an extra 22,50 $ per night as facility fees… if you plan to stay for a couple of days that can get quite expensive. Those fees are not mentioned anywhere on their booking site.

title: Staff just standing around not helpful
text:
Staff were ok, annoyed by every guest, no food as advertised in “serafina restaurant “ 

Staff needs attitude check, eye rolling and nasty comments to one another about guests in front of them- (not me but others- making them unwelcoming)

title: Love Pod times Square
text: It is in a great location for a great price. We had stayed here at least 4 times and enjoy our stay every time. The subway station is a couple of blocks away and that makes it easy to travel around the city. I park a block away and that makes for an easy in and out of the city.

title: Quality stay close to Times Square
text: When there was an issue, for instance we wanted an extra blanket we received it right away. Service was prompt. The only small issue we faced that could have been improved on was that we asked for a delay in checking out by an hour an our key tags were not adjusted automatically f we were locked out of our room upon returning from being out.

title: Always exciting to visit NY
text: Hotel is in a great location, just off Times Square.   Rooms are sound proof and one can have a good night sleep.  Even though the rooms are small, there is a good sized shower.. Staff are quite helpful and friendly.

title: Love Pod Life 💞
text:
We were wonderfully surprised with a great view of the Empire State Building. 
The free walking tours are always fun and highly recommended. 
I was a little disappointed that the outdoor spaces were closed as that is one of our favorite things about The Pod Hotels.

title: Could have been better
text: Bed was too small for two average sized people (advertised as a queen but in fact was a full). Learned about complimentary breakfast from overhearing other people check in. Only one washcloth for two adults

title: Perfect
text:
Worth the price, perfect location. Staff helpful, perfect accommodation. 
I more than recommend ! 
Our booking was for 2 persons, “bunk” room, great view, comfort +++, great bathroom. It was more than enough, even happy to be back in the room

title: Great location
text: Accommodated us with rooms near each other.  Not huge rooms but excellent location near Times Square.   Great that able to get coffe and breakfast in the bar area.   Could have done with a normal plug socket other than one  in bathroom - just usb sockets in bedroom.

title: Quite good stay
text: The checkin was very quick and nice. The location of the hotel is great. The room was quite simple but had everything we needed. The staff is very friendly and they helped us a lot. We also appreciate the luggage service they offer.

title: Crime of 200 dollars that you preleve
text: You preleve 200 dollars from my account one Day after my check out. You give me explication. I was there for mission in United Nation in Delegation of Morocco. Our embassy Will start the procedure With you

title: Great Location
text: Being close to time square was awesome and helpful for most of our activities. Close to subway and transportation. I only wish it was better price for the room sizes.We didn’t stay in the room much so it wasn’t a major issue.

title: Trip to New York!
text: The location was great!  The room was clean and small but I knew that going into this.  They did put a little fridge in the room because I ask.  Would be nice to have small coffee machine in room and ice machine on some of the floors.

title: Great choice for NYC
text: Very clean, easy to access, definitely a better price, comfortable, good location near Times Square but not in the Times Square chaos. My second visit - will happily stay next time I am going to NYC. Very good security!

title: Small room, great stay
text: If you are only staying for 2 or 3 nights this is a great location. The room is very small ... queen bed with less than 1 foot from wall, less than 2 feet from wall at foot of bed, and less than 3 feet on other side. Bed was reasonably comfortable. Room was clean. With 2 people and 2 suitcases, it was a bit cramped. Bathroom is functional but has less area to lay out things than airplane restroom. Location is great. Security is excellent: take elevator up to the lobby. Then take elevators to the floor that you are on. we were on 20th floor and found it to be reasonably quiet.

title: Good location run down accommodation
text: Wouldn’t stay again, price was good and location perfect but think you can find better places for the same price. Okay for 1/2 nights. We stayed in the room with bunkbeds and so maybe the other rooms are better.

title: Cute and clean small room, loved it!
text: I will definitely come back here. I loved how clean and cute the hotel rooms were. Parking is a block away and times Square like 2 blocks. There is so many food options around the hotel too. Another great plus is the views from your room.

title: Great place to stay
text: We spent 2 nights at the POD Times Square. Great location, just a few minute walk to the heart of Times Square. Rooms are tight, but clean and comfortable. Affordable hotel in Times Square. We would stay here again.

title: Better Pod39
text: It's my second time that I book pod. I used to go to Pod 39. I booked Times Square as my business meeting were nearby. I thought was exactly the same hotel of 39 but it wasn't. Different rules, no cleaning everyday. Not really helpful and kind staff.

title: Esperienza Negativa.
text:
Mi aspettavo per quello che io e mia moglie abbiamo pagato un buon servizio, invece già all’inizio una non bella esperienza con una ragazza della reception, avevamo riservato stavamo per pagare, la reception ci dice che c’era un problema nel pagamento, io subito cerco di contattare la Banca, abbiamo provato con tante carte, ho visto un‘atteggiamento nei confronti di mia e di mia moglie che ci siamo sentiti umiliati, alla fine sono riuscito a sbloccare il problema e a saldare il conto.
Nei giorni a venire trovavamo spesso lo specchio del bagno non pulito e spesso la notte non si riusciva a dormire, non si capiva il motivo, poi ci siamo accorti che c’era tanta polvere vicino a letto, spesso mancava le cose essenziali nel bagno. 
👎👎

title: A different price will be charged
text: I booked the room for $859.36. My credit card was charged $861.73. Even though the difference is small, it is unacceptable. This difference cannot be justified in any way and the question arises whether this always happens.

title: Good customer service, great ambience
text:
Great stay, good views but they do not have a microwave, you could request for a fridge but I didn't get one through out my stay even though I requested for it a week to my reservation. 
I recommend though.

title: Amazing experience
text: Estuvimos en NYC celebrando nuestro aniversario, sin duda alguna de acuerdo a nuestros planes fue el mejor lugar que pudimos elegir para nuestra estadía. El confort, la tranquilidad en medio de una ciudad que no es tranquila es algo valioso. El STAFF muy amable, respetuoso y servicial. Sin duda alguna es un lugar para volver y disfrutar a NYC.

title: Great hotel
text: I love this hotel I will definitely be back the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great area and I felt safe ! The rooms were perfect for me and offered an upgrade . It’s conveniently located to everything

title: Best deal in NYC
text:
POD fan! 
Well located to Times Spuare, theatre district and Hells Kitchen restarants, subways, etc. Reviews mentioned rude staff but I found great people! 
Other than a slightly loud air fan in the room, this was a great location and price! Thanks!

title: Excellent stay
text: Needed a place to stay for 1 night near Penn Station and this fit the bill.  Easy check in.  Clean.  Safe.  Comfortable.  Quiet.  Perfectly met my needs.  Great location close to Times Square.  Would definitely stay again.

title: La moyenne, mais vraiment pas plus
text:
J'y ai été suivant les conseils d'une amie qui avait déjà été dans des POD hotel. 

Les points négatifs:
- le matelas était fichu du coté où on s'assoit dessus, il m'a fallu plusieurs nuits pour le comprendre... trop tard pour mon dos
- pas de frigo dans la chambre...
- ... ok c'est le concept d'avoir des petites chambres, mais l'aménagement est à revoir, Ikea fait mieux ^^
- d'ailleurs on en parle une chaise pour des chambres de 2 ?  #logic?
- impossible de couper la clim de la salle de bain pendant la nuit, si vous êtes sensible au bruit, prévoyez des boules Quies
- l'accueil... peut mieux faire, quand vous ne comprenez pas ce que le gars dit, il vous le répète de la même façon... bref, niveau empathie,on n'y est pas. 
- la terrasse était fermée toute la durée du séjour, si vous y aller en ayant vu les photos... ben enregistrer les photos sur votre téléphone ^^ 
- les fenêtres étaient sales (oui vous allez rire en lisant ça, mais quand on vous annonce que vous êtes au 22e étage et que vous avez une superbe vue mais qu'en arrivant dans la chambre, toutes vos tentatives de photos sont un échec à cause de la crasse... j'ai été chez des amis qui vivent sur place, les leurs étaient propres, ça change pas mal).

Les points plus:  
+ Super bien situé
+ un wifi performant 
+ la vue si vous êtes assez haut
+ le restaurant est très chic et bien décoré 
+ le service départ (appel d'un taxi, stockage des bagages...)

Pour ma part, je ne regrète pas le choix de l'hotel, mais la prochaine fois, je n'irai pas là.

title: Awesome!
text: Great location, room, staff, price, everything. Felt very secure as they have 2 sets of elevators and you need the room key to go up to the rooms. Bed was very comfortable. Definitely will be back on a longer trip to take advantage if the tours!

title: Excellent budget option
text: This space was exactly as advertised.  The room was very clean (with daily housekeeping) and felt safe.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The double room and attached washroom were both small but not uncomfortable and had all the essentials as listed in the amenities section.  The only things missing were a fridge/microwave which wasn't a big deal for me.  The location is also really convenient - it's a very short walk to the subway, Times Square, food places, and drugstores.  Overall an excellent budget option!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: We were quite pleased with our stay. Location was perfect to walk to restaurants and theaters. Room was very clean and modern with sufficient amenities-most of the time was spent outside anyways. Quiet (17th floor). House keeping was provided daily. Pillows and bed were not the most comfortable but we adjusted after the first night.

title: Basically a good hotel
text: I have stayed at other POD locations before and this one was as expected.  It was clean with very few amenities.  The staff was very friendly at check-in and helpful.  But when I tried to talk to them about an electrical problem in the room at check out, the clerk acted like she really did not want to talk to me.  The only other problem was the shower.  If you want a good hot shower, you are not going to get one in the room I had.  It was warm at best.  I also wanted to report this to the check out clerk but couldh't.

title: Great value
text: Not a fancy luxurious hotel but has everything you need. Clean room, nice bed, properly working shower and not too much noise from the street. Not pretentious but down to earth which I found a relief compared to some of the other hotels I stayed in - which promise a lot but do not live up to it. Daylight did come in in the morning so that could be improved but solved with an eye mask.

title: Posto incantevole
text: Location ottima con grado di pulizia e competenza dello staff molto accurata. Ottimo anche il servizio di deposito bagagli disponibile al check out. Nulla da eccepire. Unica pecca la camera molto piccola e la mancanza di un frigobar.

title: Very good
text: I would stay at the POD hotel very clean and central , so easy to get in ,not far from subway  .so small but very well organized there is a place to organized one self .the elevator was fast and easy-to-use

title: Perfect
text: So close to Times Square, restaurant row, theatre row, piers for boat cruise, Chelsea Market, Highline….  Clean, no frills, and good value.  Close to subway.  We walked a lot.  Was a bit noisy at night from sirens but it’s NYC.

title: Mejor hotel de todo NYC
text: Mejor hotel de todo NYC, buena recepción, predisposición y acompañamiento. Ambientes amplios y muy cómodos, asi como la limpieza y la cercanía a los puntos mas importantes de la ciudad. Sin dudas volvería

title: Great location
text:
No frills, clean, central hotel. Great location,walking distance to everything. We book hotels based on location,price and cleanliness. This hotel fits the bill. Plenty of places
to eat in the locality. Avoid the "shop" next door. The owner makes the prices up as he goes. No prices on anything. He ripped me off.

title: Great place to take a rest.
text: The room isn't large, but it has everything you need. The employees are friendly. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. And the location is perfect; the subway and some viewpoints are nearby.

title: Great place
text:
Perfect location, clean room, super employees. 
If this is your first POD, know that the hotel is correctly named. While 2 people COULD have stayed in this room, it would have been tight. :) Rooms are efficient, bathroom has frosted glass walls instead of real walls.

title: Stellar service
text: The room was super clean and provided everything I needed. I did not hear any of the noise outside due to the excellent insulation. The highlight of my stay was the check-in experience. I arrived slightly earlier than the 3 pm check-in time, exhausted from my 12 hour flight. The check-in staff graciously allowed me to check-in. So instead of aimlessly wandering the streets of NYC, I was able to shower and climb into bed to rest before my evening meeting. This is an example of stellar service. It shows that POD is willing to be flexible and caring about guests' needs.

title: The best location and price
text: This is the best and cheapest hotel option in the center of nyc - five minute walk from the times square and so much more, very close to the subway and grocery shops! The staff is super nice and helpfull, rooms are small but they have everything you need - my faves are a great city view and a huge shower!

title: 5 nights at pod Times Square
text:
Such a great hotel, staff all so kind and rooms are lovely! Brilliant location too, we were upgraded to a queen room on arrival and had the most spectacular view of the empire state! 

Bar in the hotel is also nice although only went once! I’d definitely stay again only downside is the tv only had 1 channel!

title: Cost x Benefit good to NYC First experiencie
text: Good place to stay on your first visit to NYC, good service, easy access to transportation and proximity to attractions. The surrounding streets are a little dirty, but they are not dangerous to walk on even late at night.

title: Emplacement parfait
text:
Nous avons passé une agréable semaine au sein de cet hôtel très bien situé. Sa proximité avec Times Square est très pratique et permet de se rendre au centre de Manatthan très facilement. 

Les lits son très confortables, les chambres sont propres et le ménage est fait tous les jours.

title: POD Times Square. El hotel que buscas.
text: Si vas a pasar unos días para conocer la ciudad, este es sin duda tu hotel. Empezando pos su ubicación, (de verdad que no se me ocurre otra zona mejor(estación de bus que comunica con el aeropuerto a 2 min andando, Metro, Principales avenidas,7th, 6th, 8th, 5th, Times square, Broadway, Central park, Rockefeller plaza...). Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero muy modernas y limpias y con unas vistas impresionantes. Personal amable y eficaz, además, muchos de ellos y ellas hablan español.) En definitiva, recomendable 100%. Cuando vuelva a Nueva York, ya sé dónde me voy a alojar.

title: Great Stay in Midtown!!
text:
I loved my hotel experience here. I had a room on the 14th floor facing east and I had an amazing view. I am from Los Angeles so I didn't think it was loud at all. Even with the window open it was just the sounds you hear in any city. I never head any other hotel occupants or noises in the hotel and I was close to the elevator. 
I was in a full bed room and it is a compact room but it was more than enough room for me as a single occupant. The bathroom is also super roomy and had two different shower heads, one rainfall and one removable head. There is also shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Lighting is also great in the bathroom and there is a full length mirror by the door. 
I didn't need housekeeping so I didn't have any issues there but was more than happy with the towels and bedsheets I had. 
There isn't ice or a vending machine but its NY so if you need anything there is a market right next to the hotel and a 7-11 open 24 hours across the street.
I liked this location because you aren't in the heart of times square but if you are coming for a Broadway show like I did it was the PERFECT location. Totally walkable and easy to get to shows. 
Checking in and out was super easy.

title: Nossa estadia
text: Fiquei 7 noites e me surpreendi muito com a qualidade do hotel. As camas são muito confortáveis e os quartos oferecem um bom custo beneficio. Os funcionários são muito prestativos e simpáticos. A localização é ótima. Recomendaria com certeza.

title: Feeling an “Attitude of Gratitude” for Pod hotels (especially in Downtown NYC)!
text:
Location, location, location! Pod42 hotel, 1 block from Port Authority bus terminal AND if you are coming from Newark Airport, there is a direct (nonstop,reasonable priced) bus. 
Great value (bang for your buck) very clean room (sink, shower & toilet inside the bedroom-compact, hence the name “Pod” hotel) and great service and amenities (luggage storage/free tours of different areas of Manhattan, all included). 
Why pay more (on a hotel) when Pod42 (& Pod39 and Pod51) are available!?! Look no further IF U want “cheap & cheerful” accommodations Downtown NYC!  Take Care!

title: Pod Times Square
text: Nothing to say, I appreciated the cleanliness of the room, the location close to Times Square with shops and metro nearby. No noise in the rooms or upstairs. The friendly and caring who are very nice,professionnal ( thank tou David for everything)

title: Good, decent stay
text:
Perfect location. 
Friendly Staff
Room was cleaned when requested
Big shower
Yes small rooms but had a good view and was comfortable enough besides was out exploring all day.

Only negative is the constant noise of traffic all night so I’d recommend ear plugs but I was on 10th floor and you obviously have to expect it I guess being in midtown,

title: Grate stay
text: My stay was grate, front desk staff were very nice . The room could of been a bit more clean. Also the bathroom sink was clogged, It was a very little sink because of that it would get full of water quickly.

title: Excellent stay
text: I am delighted with the Pod Time Square: the location of the hotel is ideal, the room was very functional and offered a magnificent view of the buildings including the Empire State Building. I would happily come back.

title: Inexpensive Location
text: Inexpensive clean room for 5 nights.   42nd & 9th Ave is about a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and most Broadway venues. The room is adequate if you're enjoying NYC and not hanging out in the hotel.   Many food options close with different types and prices ($5 coffee & 2 donuts at 7-11 OR 2 pieces of cheese pizza & soda can for $7 at 2 locations across 9th).  No free breakfast,  no fridge,  no microwave,  but certainly you save money here anyway. Subway to 42nd & Port Authority station; 5 min walk to Pod.  Also,  nice inside and outside places to eat or sit outside of the room available.

title: Wonderful hotel choice.
text:
Hotel is in a good area near public transportation, food choices, and shopping. 
Elevator situation is a bit confusing at first but you do get the hang of it. Staff is friendly and always willing to help you.

title: Great Hotel for Short Stay!
text: I stayed here for one night and the value I got for my hotel room was amazing!  I didn't need much for my hotel since I was planning on seeing the city all day and wasn't going to be in my hotel room much. The room is small but just what I needed. The room was clean and smartly laid out. The beds were comfortable and the best part about the room was the rainfall shower! I would definitely come back to NYC to stay here!

title: Next to everything, great cost/benefit, great staff
text: Perfection for those who need a place near the Broadway district and only use the hotel for sleeping and shower. Great staff. They are willing to help you out and they smile (unusual for newyorkers). Sahara at the front desk made it all clear and easy for us! I will return to POD as often as I can.

title: Great stay
text: If you are searching for a central, clean, affordable and safe stay, this is your place to go. The staff was very nice, the rooms were clean and got cleaned every time when needed. All in all we had no point to claim about.

title: Perfect!
text: I stayed in the Pod for a week and it was a perfect stay!! The location (near Times Square), the cleanliness, the staff professionalism, the room with view, all was great! Thank you. I'll be back for an other stay

title: Très bon hôtel
text: L'emplacement est excellent, le personnel très agréable et présent au besoin ! Times square juste à côté, une très belle vue sur les buildings la chambre est très propre L'hôtel vaut vraiment le coup pour le prix, foncez !

title: Always worth it to stay here
text: I have never been disappointed with my stay here. The location is phenomenal, the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, check in is easy... what more do you need? I try to stay here whenever I visit NYC for a weekend.

title: PodRevSag
text: A nice place to stay since it is close to New York Port Authority. In addition, the price was. Affordable. Also, the staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and well kept. The location is easy to find and there are many restaurants nearby.

title: great stay!
text: I loved staying at the Pod Times Square.  It was perfect for us!  The room was clean and it had everything that we needed.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  I would stay at the POD again and plan to come back!

title: My 1st Pod Experience - Fabulous!
text: After missing my flight I had to make a quick decision on my plans for the evening and The Pod made everything simple. From an easy-check in with the amazing Sahar to enjoying a quaint yet comfortable room with amazing views, it was such a great way to extend my trip. The bar/restaurant on the main lobby floor is gorgeous and the drinks were delicious. I hope I get the chance to come back for another stay in the future. Props to housekeeping for an impeccable room - it always makes the difference.

title: Sahar made my day!
text:
Sahara was great  she explained processes & resort fees and she helped with everything else as far as the facilities in the area and check out times 
Her bright personality made New York City much better! Even no, may be tired. She was pleasant with all customers besides me.

title: Clean rooms, Excellent Value, Convenient Location
text:
I've stayed at the Pod 39 many times before and been very happy, but they were full for when I was going so I booked this one instead.  I really enjoyed staying here.  The rooms are super clean and comfortable as well as super efficiently designed and like the Pod 39, had the necessary items like an in-room safe, television screens attached to the wall and plenty of places to plug in your laptop, cellphone and ipod.  You are not going to get a place any cheaper than this in a location like this and have your own full bathroom (has a shower, no tub, but that's how it is in a lot of efficiently designed hotels in New York because tubs just take up too much space).  I had a great view down 8th avenue which really surprised me (no such views at the Pod 39) and there's a small but decent gym on the upper floors with even better views to look at while you work out (and the equipment they have is better than average, so many hotels only have the cheapest, crappiest bikes and treadmills).  It is a short walk from the Port Authority with many different subway and bus lines and plenty of great restaurants nearby (I liked the Westway Diner less than two blocks away and it's a longstanding New York institution).

The front desk people are friendly and knowledgable about the area when they are not overwhelmed by phone calls and long lines at the desk.  The place has a decent restaurant that serves all three meals; while their breakfast isn't cheap, you wouldn't pay much less to each at another place in the area.  The only downside is you can't charge anything to the room like you could at the Pod 39 (which may be different by now anyway).  They also stretch the definition of being in Times Square - I didn't think 42nd street & 9th avenue was part of that area, but it's location is still super convenient and I don't need to really stay right in the middle of Times Square anyway.

If you can do better than this place, build your own damn hotel!

title: Perfectly location at a great price
text: I would highly recommend Pod Times Square. It is such a good location, close enough to the hustle and bustle of the Times Square area but far enough to be quiet enough at night. We were on the 22nd floor and loved the view. Excellent cocktails in the bar. We didn’t eat in the restaurant so can’t comment on that.

title: Not good one hotel staff
text: I made a reservation through the hotel's official website. But within 24 hours, I found a website with a cheaper price. So I asked the reservations department if they would change the price I found. They offered to change it to the price I suggested. However, when I checked out, I paid more than the promised price. I showed the email I received to the staff, but they said the price was already greatly discounted and I ended up not paying at the promised price. The staff's attitude was disappointing. And I wasn't feeling well. All other experiences at the hotel were great. If this issue is resolved, I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

title: Staying
text: I still don’t understand why of 5 people staying in the hotel I was the only one who was asked to pay for a deposit which still i haven’t had my refound deposit in yet. The place was also super hot and we were turning off the heat since we couldn’t breath.

title: POD Times Square for the time of your life
text:
Great location! Price is right on the spot for clean, simple, basic needs. Grocery store around the corner called Big Apple Meat Market. 
There are lots of restaurants, drug stores, a Target, and theater row is nearby. 
Beer Culture around the block is good & food was good. 
Corvo Coffee is good and their Chai Coffee is the best I’ve ever had. 
Alfie’s Craft Beer Bar has great food too! Try the crispy cauliflower!!! 
Capizzi on 9th is quaint & charming! Food is excellent. Small, cozy, but call for reservations! 
Nizz
Clean rooms, linens, great shower, not luxurious pillow top beds but comfy!

title: EXCELLENT VALUE
text: This place is a GREAT value for money.  Centrally located (times sq is of course a tourist trap but it IS in the middle of Manhattan so you can get anywhere fast), clean, and cute. The louge area is very pretty and even the lobby is up an elevator so you are definitely high up. We were on the 16th floor and had a nice view. We had bunk beds (booked last minute) and yes the room was small but their were TVs on both levels of bed were cute, tons of outlets at each level, and the beds were a decent size (my husband is 6ft and a bigger guy and he was fine). Check in and out were quick and friendly. We had an issue with the upper TV and they sent a guy up immediately. He was also very friendly and fixed the problem almost instantly. Room was clean, lots of light from floor length windows, we didn't notice any outside noise except a few ambulances, and the bathroom was great. Shower was large and plenty of light to do makeup. Shower glass is frosted but not fully opaque just fyi.

title: Great Value in a Good Location
text:
looking for a simple place to sleep as our days and evenings were fully booked out we chose the Pod Times Square and were not disappointed.
it was great value and the location is good, a short suitcase pull from either Port Authority Bus Terminal or Penn Station. The rooms are small but clean and the bunk beds were comfortable.
The location is close to the tourist spots plus there are plenty of good value bars and restaurant's in the neighbourhood.
well worth the stay.

title: Clean, nice staff
text: Picked this hotel because of reviews that our was very clem and its location as we were catching a train at Penn Station at 6am. Rooms were very clean (my biggest concern with hotel rooms) and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay again next time I need a room in the city.

title: Great place!!
text: Love everything about this place. Location, staff, cleanliness and value! Great neighborhood. Close to bars, restaurants, Times Square. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Convenient non hotel parking in middle of block.

title: Great stay & location
text: We stayed for a quick Valentine's Day visit. It's a good place, not too expensive. The small and cozy hotel rooms are cute but definitely focus on stylishness more than having a wide range of features & amenities, but it was a decent stay for a night in the city. Location is a big plus; across the street from Port Authority & a couple away from Times Sq / 42nd street station.

title: Solo woman traveling to NYC
text: Is the best location, NY Port Authority 3-4 minutes walking distance, Times Square walking distance maybe 15 minutes, and many subway stations. Lots of places to eat, coffee shops, even a grocery store on the same building. Definitely my place for my next visit. Because I was by myself I used Uber.

title: Great value, uncomfortable bed!
text: The Pod Times Square is conveniently located to subway stops and train stations, the staff was all very nice and the room was clean. My only complaint is that the bed was very uncomfortable, I didn’t notice it the first night because I was coming off of a red eye, but I did not sleep much the second night which made my stay not so enjoyable!

title: Pod Hotel just OK
text: The stay was okay.  This is a bare bones room - nothing fancy.  I booked for price and value, but had issues with getting towels and soap even after requesting housekeeping service.  Rooms aren't clean each day unless you request.  They are still trying to follow COVID policies.  The price was okay, but I only saved about 30 per day for 3 out 5.  I could have stayed at the Westin for around the same price.  There cost was 185 per night.

title: Great Value for Location
text: This Pod Hotel is a great value. The location is fantastic: right at Times Square, with lots of good restaurants, and a few blocks from a central subway hub. The rooms are clean and the hotel itself seems safe and well-maintained. The bar/restaurant is pleasant. And the prices are beyond reasonable. We will return to this hotel again.

title: Relación calidad precio un 10
text:
Muy bien situado para moverse por Manhattan. A 5 minutos de Times Square y 2 minutos del Metro para desplazarse a otros lugares.
Habitación pequeña pero con todo lo necesario. 
Tiene una lista en la recepción para apuntar los días que quieres que pase el servicio de limpieza.

title: Tiny perfection
text: The room was comfortable and well laid out. The location and price? Excellent! And the friendliest staff anywhere. One note: I'd suggest the queen room for a couple and watch out for the sharp corner of the bed.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Buena ubicación, hotel limpio con buena presencia, la chica de recepción Sahar, muy amable, hablaba español perfectamente, nos ha dado una habitación a elegir y encima con unas vistas geniales, sin duda repetiría para ser 3 estrellas esta genial

title: Recommended
text:
It was the 3rd time in this hotel, it’s definitely perfect located to the Times Square and others. It’s a modern Hotel and the staff is friendly. The guest room was small but that’s normal for NYC. Next time it needs a better clean up. Especially the rug, bedsheets and typical dust spots.
In the past it was much cleaner and you have to wait for hot water when u wanna take a shower evenings.

title: Excellent
text: I stayed in a two bed room. despite the room being a bit small (as expected), my stay was excellent. great shower and bathroom, AC working perfectly and overall great! very clean! we also had access to a rooftop and a restaurant

title: 10/10 would recommend!
text: Perfect location, 5 mins walk from Times Square but far enough away to avoid the hustle and bustle and noise. Rooms were larger than expected, we booked a queen but had been warned online about how small hotel rooms were in nyc, this was not the case, definitely enough storage space for cases. The hotel was clean and tidy and staff were really friendly. Would 100% recommend this hotel if looking for a place to stay in central New York!

title: A 63yrs woman traveling solo
text: The location is great, 10 min walk to Bryant Park, Public Library, Grand Central Station and Times Square. Port Authority NYC is 2 min walk. The staff are friendly, they go above and beyond to help with everything I needed to know. Definitely this will be my hotel from now on and I’ll recommended to family and friends.

title: Séjour Père & Fille
text:
Un hôtel à l'esprit jeune idéalement situé pour un séjour à New-York. Même si les chambres sont petites, elles suffisent largement pour se reposer, elles sont bien insonorisées et les lits confortables.
Le personnel est très sympa !

title: Excellent location
text: Brilliant location for our stay. Times Square only a short walk away and subway station 2 mins from hotel. Hotel is clean and staff were friendly. Room is small but perfect for what we were looking for. Would highly recommend for any city break to New York.

title: Perfecto
text: Estuve 3 días con mi sobrina y todo fue genial, la atención,la habitación muy limpia, nos limpiaron la habitación, tienen servicio de guardamaletas gratuito, muy recomendable el lugar,muy céntrico,buena conexión con metro y trenes.

title: Simple, clean, value, location
text: Great location and price. Simple and clean rooms. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Just a heads up that there’s no mini fridge in the rooms, so be aware at what you bring to eat/drink. Love the lounge area on the lobby floor for coffee, drinks and snacks. Our new go-to hotel!

title: Perfection
text:
I really had a good time. The room was very clean. The service was great. The location is perfect right in the middle of city and view was nice. 
I really enjoyed my time during my stay in this hotel. This would be a perfect option for people who travel with limited budget.

title: Perfect location
text: The hotel have PERFECT LOCATION, good for couples scape. Is my 2nd time in this hotel. Is clean, is relax and quiet. Have a Starbucks and a Dinner very closer for breakfast. I love the view in the high rooms. I think The Pod is good when you go to meet the city

title: Great experience!
text: Great experience! Staff is very nice, room was very clean. They should have more channels in the TV to watch than just the news. Location is great. I noticed that now they have group tours which is great.

title: Super Lage, tolle Zimmer.
text: Tolles Hotel mit ausreichend großen Zimmern. Die Anbindung an die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel ist super. Die Zimmer sind gut isoliert und man hört von der Straße nur wenig. Der Zimmerservice findet nur nach Anmeldung statt, was aber ausreichend ist. Das Badezimmer ist ausreichend.

title: A comfortable room for a night or two
text: The location and price drew us to it; it's a good "cheap and cheerful" overnight (or two) place when in NYC. Staff was extremely helpful; provided us a kettle for hot water and went looking for lost slippers.  Very convenient to PABT and other transit terminals

title: Unfriendly cold stuffs
text: No room cleaning service unless you ask and put your room number on the list in advance. How should I know that? Nobody told me when checked in. And there was an incident that fire alarm started beeping in the middle of the night at 2am. And someone shouted through speakers it's false alarm like someone pressed it. Jet lagged and sleep deprived and waking up to false alarm was terrible. No one apologised or anything bruh

title: Great Stay...
text: I spent 6 nights at Pod Times Square Hotel. It was very easy to enjoy the city of New York, due to its location. Many restaurants nearby, many attractions, easy access to public transportation. POD Times Square is definitely my new home in New York City.

title: Perfeito
text:
Localização perfeita. Tem udo o que  você precisa. O  quarto era minusculo,  porém pra que maior? A gente mal  fica nele.  Cama confortável, chuveiro bom.
Recepção com otimo atendimento Ficaria nele novamente mais quantas vezes  precisar. 
Super recomendo.

title: Budget hotel
text:
Great value hotel with everything you could need clean comfortable bed, clean bathroom facilities, handy usb charging ports.
Surrounded by shops and places to eat and a short walk away from Times Square

title: Muy recomendado.
text: Gracias. Son los mejores. Habitaciones modernas y cómodas. Minimalistas pero diseńadas perfectamente. Muy de mi gusto. Bańo privado cada habitación con agua caliente y espacio agradable en ducha y todas las necesidades. Muy contento. Quedamos muy agradecidos. Ya queremos regresar a New York y de seguro volvernos a quedar con ustedes.

title: Great concept, design and space
text: Very neat concept, contemporary design and use of space. Staff were friendly and helpful, especially those working at the concierge desk and baggage storage. The only issue is that the air in our pod unit was very very dry.

title: Just what I needed for a quick weekend trip
text: I loved my stay at the Pod Times Square. The room was so tiny and cute, and it was just enough space for me for my quick trip to New York. The room was very basic, so there was no fridge or microwave in the room, but it was very comfortable and just what I needed. The value was great, and it was so close to all the action of Times Square. I would recommend as long as you're not looking for anything fancy, just a nice, comfortable place to sleep and relax a bit.

title: Glorified hostel with ratchet guests
text:
Beware, this place is essentially a glorified hostel. I paid $150 / night and went based on the reviews which were terribly misleading. Not only are the beds and pillows horribly uncomfortable, during my stay there was an awful woman listening to music in the hallway at midnight who after I politely asked to turn the music down proceeded to spend the next 4 hours ranting and swearing at the top of her voice up and down the hall, slamming her door repeatedly then arguing with security on multiple occasions until eventually I called the police at 4:30am because nobody on our floor had slept a wink and hotel management wasn’t dealing with the situation. 

Absolutely awful place, avoid like the plague.

title: Great location and value
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the property was for the price. It is easily walkable from Penn Station and the conference I went to at the Marriott in Times Square. The bar and lounge was a nice quiet place to a drink at the end of the day. The staff was great.

title: Beautiful
text: The location. The room. Everything is clean and friendly staff. The time square is here by. The train station also neate by. The beds are soft and clean. The staff helpful. The location itself very convenient

title: Economy done well
text: Their selling point is spartan accommodations that allow for relatively reasonable prices in a great location on Manhattan, which they provide, but every time I go I notice how absolutely courteous and professional the staff is.  Everybody we've ever encountered has had that air of competence and charm that you get at all New York lodging and dining places.  Also, this time for the first time we looked into the bar and restaurant and, in contrast to the bare bones lodging, they're very attractive.  Also, they've address the bathroom gender issues in a way that ensures that everybody is welcome but also that everybody has much privacy as they could possibly want.

title: Disgusting
text: I don't speak much English and it was very unpleasant to arrive at that place and be treated that way. I don't know how they have people like that working there. To leave the hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpful, they also spoke Spanish and were able to help me.……………………………………….………………………………………..

title: Great location, great price!
text: The price of this hotel as well as the location was amazing. The room was small as advertised, but completely fine for a few nights stay (we stayed 4 nights). The bathroom was spacious and came with toiletries. Free wifi which worked great and a secure area for bags when checking out so you can come back for them later which was great. The view from the hotel room was amazing! The beds weren’t very comfortable, but again for a few nights totally fine.

title: Hotel experience
text: Everything was ok, the room was not thaaaaat clean but it was ok, I still enjoyed it and everything was sooo close, I made it to the location using the train and had to walk just like 5 minutes from the subway. If I visit NY again I’ll stay at Pod for sure.

title: Awesome stay in the middle of everything!
text: This was an overall excellent stay. Stay at a room with a bunk bed and private bathroom that had everything I needed for my stay. Staff was super friendly. Area was safe. Walkable to Times Square and Bryant Park. Subway station is super close. 100% recommended

title: Convenient, Easy, and Great Value
text: I had never heard of a pod hotel before but now that I've experienced it, I would definitely choose one again! After all, we did not go to NYC to spend lots of time in our hotel room - all we needed to do there was sleep. The room was very comfy, and a lot quieter than we expected. I was pleasantly surprised by the small details that made our stay even more convenient, like hooks on the wall for our coats and bags, small nooks at the bedside to hold and charge our devices, etc. Really appreciate this option for an inexpensive stay!

title: NYC on a budget
text: The price is right for this economy sized room. If you are visiting NYC and are constantly on the go and just need the basics, this works great.  Building felt secure and location next to Hells Kitchen was fun and subway was never far away. A mini fridge or ice machine would have been nice. Rooftop bar was nice and available for morning coffee.

title: Pod Times Square
text:
I took an overnight trip to NYC for a concert at MSG and somehow found this little gem of a place while searching the Internet.

Location 5/5

Pod Times Square is conveniently located on 42nd and 9th, just a 10 minute walk from Moynihan Train Station and an even shorter walk to Port Authority. Times Square is only a block away, yet the area immediately around the hotel is relatively quiet in comparison to that bustling hustle! Plenty of amenities all around, too!

Service 5/5

I arrived at Pod about an hour and a half before my scheduled check-in time, thinking I would only be dropping off my suitcase, but the front desk receptionist happily offered to check me into my room early, which was awesome. Everyone I encountered throughout my stay was friendly and hospitable.

Hotel 5/5

I'd like to note here that Pod is not a huge, luxurious hotel with roomy guest quarters, as the name would imply. I chose a bunk room, which, as you would imagine, had bunk beds. The room was compact, yet comfortable for one person, and had all of the amenities one would need for a comfortable and affordable place to sleep for a night or two. I will definitely consider Pod on future trips to NYC.

title: Perfect Stay!
text: The perfect weekend getaway! Great customer service, knowledgeable and welcoming staff. Our room smelled good and our sheets smelled freshly washed. Our go to place when in the city and cannot wait until we visit again!

title: Would stay here again
text: Came to New York for my 40th Birthday. After looking at many hotels I came across this one. The security of the hotel is wonderful. You have to tap your room key in order for the elevator to take you to any floor of the hotel. The price and location are excellent for. Would definitely stay here again. The room was clean, the bunk beds were comfortable.

title: Milos
text: The hotel met all my expectations, great location close to the subway and Times Square, everywhere is walkable, the hotel room is smaller but perfectly adequate and has a large bathroom. The hotel also has an excellent bar and a luxurious view from the room. Sufficient gym for a morning warm up before exploring NYC.

title: Worth it
text: Seamless check in/out process, nearby covered parking, location ideal and within walking distance to everything we came to NYC for. Room was clean, bed was comfortable it was quiet. Temperature in room got really hot overnight but was able to crack the window so had a great breeze. Our only issue (not a REAL issue) was that they forgot to give us wash clothes to shower and it took a minute to figure out the shower knobs and how to switch between shower heads. We will stay here every time we come to NYC.

title: practical and quick
text:
my stay at The Pod Times square was great, the check in and check out service was practical and quick. The location was great and the room was very functional. I recommend .
the price is fair and the efficient service is friendly too.

title: Great value for the location
text: We needed a place to stay while our apartment was under construction and this place was well-located and reasonable for NYC.  They don't clean every day, but will come if you request it.  We did not request it, but we did request fresh towels after a few days and they brought them right up.  Would be nice if they came in to clean every few days without asking, though.

title: Perfect hotel
text: Lived this hotel. Very clean and useful rooms. Wonderful placement, cute cafe/bar. I really would recomend it! Right next to times square, and u get help with airport transport. Overall great place to stay

title: Was amazing and everything was very closed
text: Everything was amazing the staff the rooms all of them, the most good thing is everything is closed the hotel. If u need starbucks or the subway station u have a lots ones there and the view to the empire stare wow

title: good value and great location
text: rooms are small but i don’t think you need anything bigger than that really. very well located, great value. easy check in and check out. 3 mns walk to times square, 3 mns walk to metro station. i’d recommend

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel and would recommend it to everyone. Yes, the rooms are small but that is what you pay for. If you compare it to other hotel rooms and prices: this is a great deal. Location is great and it’s clean.

title: Great Value and Location
text: While the rooms are small, that's not unexpected for NYC. And, we don't spend much time in them. The location was perfect and cost more than competitive. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The bar has a nice atmosphere and the bar tender makes a great Espresso Martini!

title: Location, Staff, and Safe; Great hotel!
text: I visit this hotel for personal and professional trips. Always wonderful. Staff is incredible. Location is ideal. Bryant Park is a quick walk, little shop around the corner is great, you have everything you need within 1 block.

title: 50th Birthday!
text: Walking distance to Times Square and the transit station. Good local eats near by. Concierge is very knowledgeable and recommended some amazing places to eat. Hotel was very quiet even though it is close to midtown. Would visit again

title: Great budget hotel I would definitely stay again
text: I couldn't rate this hotel highly enough. The room is small and basic as it is low budget, but you get everything you need. The place was clean and modern. Anything you want or need if you ask the staff they will get it for you. The staff are very helpful and friendly. There were plenty towels in the room of good thickness and varying sizes. Housekeeping came a couple of times and were good and non-intrusive. (I think you can have housekeeping come every day if you want). The bed was comfy. The room gets nice and warm if you put the heating on (I went in winter). I was cold the first night as there is only a blanket rather than a duvet, but I asked for a second blanket and they brought me one no problem, and I was nice and warm from then on. The whole process from first inquiring, including checking in and out went seamlessly. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Clean Place Close to Times Square
text: My room was very clean. I went on a trip with my father and was able to get a bunk bed room. I was able to see Some of the billboards from Times Square from my room. The staff was lovely! They answered any questions I had and were very expedient.

title: Tiny! But for the price, it can't be beat
text: If you don't mind small spaces, it's honestly perfect. The location is fantastic: right beside multiple restaurants, a corner store, and within walking distance to iconic spots like Rockefeller Center and popular shopping spots (Nintendo store, Hershey store, Disney store). Check-in and check-out were a breeze, room was clean. My friend and I had a bunk bed room. We enjoyed the fact that we each had our own television. The top bunk was a little difficult to get up onto mostly because of the ladder being made of metal... it was a bit painful on the feet, and nothing to grip onto to pull yourself onto the bed... would probably not be an issue for a child or younger person (I'm mid-30s). The first night we found it to be extremely noisy--to be expected since the hotel is in a high traffic area. However I realized by the second night that the window was not completely sealed shut. If you're a light sleeper, highly recommend making sure that the window is closed as snugly as possible for optimal noise reduction! Our phone receiver had a low-battery issue and would beep sporadically, despite being properly installed on the base and plugged in as it should have been. We ended up turning the receiver off and keeping it off the base as it was the only way to get the beeping to stop. Despite these inconveniences, we enjoyed our stay and the staff and guests we encountered were nothing but friendly! I will definitely stay here again.

title: 2nd time, Good as the 1st.
text: For being a "3 star hotel" it really should be more. Over all the only things I would change would be, a bigger sign out front or at the very least a second one higher up. Additionally I wish there was a little more information on how to get to the lobby for first time visitors. Wonderful hotel with interesting rooms, friendly staff, and a location that it great to explore Time Square and the surrounding areas. Would definitely return again and again.

title: Terrific service at this small but very clean hotel in a great location!
text: I visit New York for business at least once a year for the last 15 years or so. We booked 10 rooms here for a team of people from my company this year. This is my first time staying at this hotel, and I’ve got to say the service has been terrific, especially from “Sahar” at check-in!  The rooms are somewhat small (normal for NYC), but they are super-clean. It can be hard to find a quiet room in New York, but the SW facing rooms are actually very quiet. (NE was significantly louder.) This is a great location for walking to either the Javits Convention Center or Times Square. I will definitely be back.

title: Pod Times Square
text: I love this hotel! The location was perfect for the price and I felt very safe here. It was perfect for my little get away with my boyfriend. we had such an amazing view as well.  they also held our bags after check out which was so appreciated.

title: Extremely uncomfortable.
text: Bedding extremely hard along with rough pillows my whole body has been sore since staying at this hotel. The sheets would not stay on. The blanket which you use to cover yourself was so thin you had to keep the heat up high in the room.

title: Great Guest Service
text: My absolute favorite hotel to stay at in the city. It’s cheaper than any other place, and so so clean. There’s just enough space for me & my things. The staff is also so accommodating. Sahar specifically helped me stay in the same room when my reservation was split so I didn’t have to pack up all over again. I can’t recommend Pod enough!

title: Excellent Hotel - Convenient Location
text: I found the hotel to be excellent. I needed something affordable as close to Midtown as possible. The location is very convenient. I especially appreciated the complimentary walking tours they offer. If your travel plans involve the Theater District, Lincoln Center, and Times Square, you would be wise to save a little money and stay at this hotel.

title: Very good
text: In my opinion its a small room for two people but everything else was perfect. We ran out of toilet paper and body wash but as soon as we asked the staff they provided everything we needed. The location is awesome, and overall I`m never dissapointed by this hotel. I would stay there again.

title: Perfect location for a short stay
text: Perfectly located, fair price, no hidden costs, kind staff, new and clean rooms, bathroom with shower as i like them, quiet room even if we're in a noisy area, We feel secure in the hotel. Good restaurants in the vicinity.  Close to Times Square, the High line, etc.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I only had one night here but it was perfect for what I needed. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything I needed. The staff were helpful and there was a restaurant where I could pick up breakfast which made it super convenient for a quick stay. I would fully recommend it and would come back again.

title: Buena opción!
text: Excelente relación precio calidad. Hotel limpio, muy buena ubicación. Habitaciones pequeñas, con lo justo y necesario. Lo único que le estaría haciendo falta a la habitación es un pequeño frigobar, útil para elementos básicos de la diaria.

title: Great location and friendly service
text: location is awesome, it is right next to the port authority and super close to Time square! If you have any question about traveling around New York City, you can ask people in the hotel they are super friendly and willing to provide some tips for planning out NYC trip.

title: It was a pleasure to stay there
text: Like I said, it was a pleasure to stay at a great location. Great staff nice bar. Everybody was very helpful and knowledgeable. They were able to answer almost all of our questions since this was our first time to New York City again very very helpful. Rooms were clean. nothing to complain about would stay there again. Also would recommend to anyone.

title: Great location, but crowds overwhelm the experience
text: Obviously popular with travelers from all over the world because of its location, the lobby and elevators seem constantly crowded which as always frustrating. Daily room service never happened, even when requested.

title: Comfortable place to stay.
text: The room was comfortable for such a small space. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable and I got a good night's sleep! The location was convenient. It was fairly quiet in the room, considering what a busy part of the city we were in. Staff was friendly and helpful!

title: Location location location!
text: Excellent hotel in fab location just moments away from Ties Square , compact room was clean and modern and every mod con that you could need including excellent wifi and loan of a kettl.  Great customer service.

title: It needs to be better priced for the quality
text: Bed and bed sheets are bad. room noise is bad. The overall experience with employees and cleaning was good. price not sure justifies, you can get a bigger room and better bed at hotels close by. location is good.

title: Cheap, clean and nice. But really small. Pointless "resort" fee
text:
Stayed here one night when going to see the Rockettes

It was clean, modern, basic. I would stay here again, I would give it 4 stars but it has that stupid resort fee added, so I knocked one star off for that. Given the service and the basic accommodations I can't imagine what that's even for, other than adding $25 to the price and reducing the impact of variability in rates to them

You're in a tiny room with a bunk bed. All I could think when lying there was, this is what a couple of hundred a night gets you? But that's not really their fault. NYC prices are insane.

Anyway, it was OK, but it really is a sardine can. Don't expect any frills.

title: Great Hotel with great staff... in the middle of it all !!
text: Great hotel in the middle of it all.  The staff was super friendly and efficient.  The restaurant staff was also super friendly and professional.  It was my 2nd time in the city and my ladies 1st visit.  Thanks for making it such a great experience.  Special shout out to Shawn Mason, their front office director.  We had an incident that was beyond his control happen.  Shawn went above and beyond to make it right.  Strong finish to a great time in NYC!!  We will definitely recommend them to fam and friends!!

title: Quick nyc experience
text: Our initial experience with Shanna was extremely disappointing. She had the worst attitude and was extremely rude and disrespectful. Again after speaking with the director we may give it another shot in 2024 hopefully without any hick-ups. Thank you for having us

title: A different POD
text: Having stayed many times at the two PODS on the East Side, this location was quite a departure.  First, 22 stories and a quite modern building (retrofitted from what, I wonder).  Second, bring earplugs, even on the 21st floor.  42nd Street at 7th seemed like a continual EMT/Firetruck/Bus/Garbage Truck meet-up.  Yea, I know, Times Square.  But, it has all the great qualities of the other PODS, friendly, capable staff, real value, and most everything works.

title: Warm welcoming great place to stay in NYC!
text: Was upgraded minutes after making my booking! The rooms are good I was pleasantly surprised! There was a very warm welcome and they made me feel at home! The exceptional one was Sahar she was amazing and was more than accommodating she’s something special! She’s too Leng as well! Loved this place and will return!

title: Excellent for what you need in NYC!
text: Absolutely great hotel if you want a base to explore NYC. I stayed with my partner, and although the room was small, it was very clean and had all the amenities we needed (we weren’t in there very much anyway as we were out exploring). Staff seemed lovely, and the building itself was very secure and clean.

title: Great location
text: Great  size room .very  clean  .I loved the fact that the Westside theater was around  the corner . Food options were all over the place. parking garage one block away  .check in and check out service  was quick and pain less

title: Trip in NYC
text:
rapport qualité / prix horriblement cher ; chambre non nettoyée au cours des 3 jours de séjour, et un peu bruyant dans le couloir.
Aucun accessoire à disposition (surtout pour une chambre à un tel prix / standing), hormis le seche-cheveux.
Très bon emplacement et personnel courtois.

title: Visit to NY
text: This hotel was very nice to stay at, the scenery overlooking the city was very nice, staff was very friendly and helpful. Very close to places like diners, shops, restaurants and best of all Times Square!

title: Maybe not worth the money saved
text: Nowhere to get water! Had to ask multiple staff, bartender finally found some. No vending machines. Coffee/breakfast bar not very user friendly, almond milk in the creamer carafe, pastries and juice low quality. Sheet and thin blanket on bed, no other bedding available. Overall lack of amenities and service made me wish I'd spent a little more to stay at a regular hotel. On the plus side, the decor in the room was nice, view nice, shower very nice.

title: Small but nice
text: We had a twin bunk room. The room was small but we were only there to sleep. The shower was nice with built in shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Each bunk had a charging station and tv which was nice. High ceilings and big windows helped to make it feel bigger

title: A perfect location is not enough
text: The location is perfect as starting point to go everywhere, but a little noisy even when the window is closed. The bathroom and shower are gorgeous but the room is not properly clean, and you find only a small piece of soap on the basin to wash hands. The person who did the cleaning decided that my plastic bag with zip and underwear in it was worth to throw away. At the reception they pretended they were trying to help but didn’t care. They promised a small refund as I asked, and after a while they said that I had to blame booking…I had to buy new underwear and I expected the refund for it since a serious hotel would provide for it

title: Room service and car booking service.
text:
Lack of room service throughout my stay. Despite being a guest for five nights, room service was only asked on the day of checkout.
Vetting and communicating with external car booking service providers need to be improved.

title: Very centrally, located
text: Within blocks of the main part of Times Square and the Metro Station. And very central to the main sights. The room was clean, and really well said out. The beds were comfortable. The staff was very welcoming and helpful

title: Book now ! Great spot
text: Perfect location.  Friendly staff. Functional  clean room. Great value for money. Stayed in room 831 nice view. Bunk bed rooms have alot more space. Use your room key to operate  the elevator to the  desired  floor. Public bathrooms  in bar if you need them.

title: Good stay for the price
text: The Pod was a good hotel for the price. You are in a great location near to Times Square, so many restaurants to try, and subway stations conveniently near. The hotel provides bare minimum amenities, but if you are planning to sight see and won’t be in the room much, it wasn’t a problem. Staff were very friendly and were eager to provide more towels and toilet paper upon request. Our only issue with the room was our sink did not drain properly and would pool up to nearly full and it was never fixed despite saying something. Overall though, the hotel was great for the price, clean, nice location, and had a great view to the city.

title: Pods Rule
text: I've stayed at Pod42 many, many times: ideally located, very comfortable and well-designed rooms, and friendly and accommodating staff. 9th Ave at 42nd St is very close to all subways and the scores of diverse restaurants nearby on 9th Ave are amazing.

title: Small but good enough
text: My friend and I needed last minute accommodations and the Pod Times Square had the price point in our range. It's tiny but clean and the location was pretty central to everything. I slept well. It's small but had exactly what I needed would def stay there again!

title: You get what you pay for
text:
Location wise, it's pretty good, until you get a room that faces flashing lights all night and the windows only block 75% of the light. The rooms were clean enough considering the size. It was simple, spartan, and it would have been perfectly fine for us if it weren't for the fact the beds are somewhat uncomfortable, putting in requests for no housekeeping and still experiencing attempts for housekeeping (no, there was no door sign to put up), and for a confirmed late checkout to be ignored.. Spend the extra 50-100 to go somewhere else because Times Square is a zoo anyway, you might as well be comfortable.

Proximity to Hell's Kitchen was nice, though, so at least all the food choices nearby were phenomenal.

title: Worst experience
text:
This was the worst hotel I have ever been to.  The rooms are so overpriced for the absolute tiny size that they are.  The staff never said good morning or evening every time we returned.  We were welcomed one night by a vagrant outside peeing on the wall.  Then another night right by the elevator another vagrant was begging money from us.  I was with my 11 year old daughter and she was so scared.
You literally couldn't swing a cat in the room, the shower was luke warm at best and no maid service even though its a pricey hotel.  .
When we were leaving we asked the front desk to order us a taxi and were told they would only order a taxi if we were going to the airport, which we weren't, we were going to another hotel.  We had to wait 2 hours outside with our suitcases and still no taxi  After which I went and complained and the front desk man tried to help but said the best thing is to walk a whole block with our suitcases to get a cab  I wouldn't stay here again, even if it was free.  The only reason i gave a 1 rating is there was no 0 .

title: Best Bang for your Buck
text: We stayed at the POD TIMES SQUARE recently for an overnighter. BEST decision ever! Staff was SO helpful AND friendly. Close to great restaurants and the theatres. Room was comfy & clean... AND so much cheaper than some of the other places around! A++++ Highly recommend.

title: Best choice price/location
text:
We loved our stay. Hotel is located at one of the best places Just 1 or 2  blocks from Times Square. Even for the dates we travel in December the price was great, the room is small but comfy and just what you need to sleep, rest and take a shower. The staff was really nice to us, and they gave us an early check in as we arrived at 8am, and took care of our luggage on check out day so we can enjoy the rest of the day before our flight.
Recommend 10/10

title: Only only positive was location
text: The beds were horribly hard on our backs and the pillows were rice paper thin. Never slept well. The shower is very slippery, falls definitely a possibility. Only, I mean only positive was the location. Never again.

title: Motel 6 experience for a very expensive stay
text: One washcloth and constantly asking for more and the staff gets annoyed. The bar is nonexistent as is closed most of the time. No microwave anywhere, no ice anywhere. Remote control not user friendly. Way toooooo much money for this place. The room is sooooo tight.  It is expected, but not for the kind of money they charge.

title: Small on space but big on location. affordable! Nothing too much for staff. Location was really perfect
text: Superb location. Close enough to walk everywhere but just enough away to allow peaceful sleeps when traffic calmed. JFK route subway 7 and air-train to 42nd st @ 8th. 4 min walk to pod!!! Shower and bathroom facilities were perfect, toiletries and towels were really nice grade. Never a wait for lifts, staff very helpful, beds comfortable. Overall will definitely come back and recommend to everyone.

title: Pod hotel -Small but clean
text:
Good hotel and location.
No perks when staying here like an ice machine to access. you can get a cup of ice in the bar... but only when they are open.
They also do not have 'do not disturb' signs. So if you do not want the cleaning staff to come in you need to let the front desk know... while I did do this, the cleaning staff still came in, because the front desk didn't get the message into the system. In my opinion, unnecessary human error. just have the sign that one can hang on the door handle.

title: Great location
text:
Close to the main attractions and metro stations. Also you can do everything walking 
But I believe the cleaning should be mandatory and every day.
It’s a great place to stay in New York City 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

title: A Compact Gem Near Everything
text: I was very pleased with this place. I had walked by at many times before, but never gone inside. I was so impressed with the room. The cleanliness, the staff, the quiet everything was just perfect. The rooms are small and compact but for what I needed It was perfect. I will stay there again and highly recommend it

title: Just What You Need
text: We stayed 2 nights and loved everything about the place, it was clean, convenient, quiet, the staff was nice and helpful. The room was cute and cozy.  The elevators were super fast!  This is now our go-to hotel from now on!!

title: The cheapest we could find
text:
We booked here because at that time it was the cheapest in the area.
In the overall it’s a good hotel even tho we could hear car and siren from the street all night. The rooms are clean but a little small.

title: Nice room, friendly staff, perfect location
text: The staff is friendly and helpful. Room is tiny, but perfect, has everything that you need. Its clean, the bed is comfortable. I really loved the view too. I traveled alone, but in this hotel I felt safe. The location is perfect, you can visit lot of things from here, even walking.

title: Toller Aufenthalt
text: Wir genossen unseren Aufenthal im  Pod sehr. Die Lage ist zentral und zu Fuss sind viele Punkte zuerreichen. Den Verkehr hörten wir von unserem Zimmer zwar, störte jedoch kaum. Wir würden ein ander Mal wieder kommen.

title: Would stay again
